required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Pharmacokinetics of a Single 14C-labeled Dose of Risedronate or Alendronate Followed by Once-a-week Unlabeled Oral Dose
clinical_study.official_title: Study to Determine the Pharmacokinetics of a Single 14C-labeled Intravenous Dose of Risedronate or Alendronate Followed by Once-a-week Unlabeled Oral Dose to Postmenopausal Women With Osteopenia or Osteoporosis

brief_summary.textblock: The primary objective of this study is to compare the urinary excretion of 14C-labeled risedronate and alendronate over 28 days.

primary_outcome.measure: compare the urinary excretion of 14C-labeled risedronate and alendronate over 28 days.

secondary_outcome.measure: to compare urinary excretion and serum concentration-time profiles of 14C-labeled risedronate and alendronate over 52 weeks.

arm_group.description: 0.23 mg 14C-labeled risedronate, followed 7 days later with oral 35 mg risedronate once a week for 52 weeks
0.45 mg 14C-labeled alendronate, followed 7 days later with oral 70 mg of alendronate once a week for 52 weeks

intervention.description: 0.23 mg 14C-labeled risedronate, followed 7 days later with oral 35 mg risedronate once a week for 52 weeks followed by another 14C-labeled risedronate followed weekly by 35 mg risedronate for 3 weeks

0.45 mg 14C-labeled alendronate, followed 7 days later with oral 705 mg alendronate once a week for 52 weeks followed by another 14C-labeled alendronate followed weekly by 70 mg alendronate for 3 weeks

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- have medical history documentation verifying postmenopausal status of at least 2 years (natural or surgical). If not documented, confirmation will be required using estradiol < 20 pg/mL and follicle stimulating hormone (FSH) > 40 IU/mL;
- have osteopenia or osteoporosis (< 1.002 g/cm2 Lunar or < 0.882 g/cm2 Hologic) as determined by DXA of the lumbar spine (AP or PA view, L1-L4). This corresponds to a T-score of approximately < -1.5.
Exclusion Criteria:
- any clinically significant out-of-range laboratory values and vital signs,
- a clinically significant cardiovascular, hepatic, renal, or parathyroid disease, in the opinion of the Investigator
- a known hypersensitivity to bisphosphonates
